evidence.text:
Person B: You always have cookies on you?
Person A: Do you want one?

Person A: You shouldn’t drink coffee after lunch. How many do you drink a day?
Person B: None of your business. Seven.

Person A: Oh! I chose you as my mentor.
Person B: What?
Person A: I chose you as my mentor.
Person B: I’m not a part of that program.
Person A: You are.
Person B: No I’m not.
Person A: You are. You’re on the list. I got an email and I clicked on your name. So- You’re on the list.

Person B: I have no idea who sent you that email but they’ll have to find someone else. I don’t have time.
Person A: There’s no need for the-

Person B: I graduated from Yale cum laude and was recruited by an investment firm. The selection process was gruesome. There were six rooms, and in every room, I had to answer certain questions and solve math formulas. One of the questions was how many ping pong balls would fit in that specific room.
Person B: At the end they gave me a hypothetical case of a company that was in deep trouble, and I had to figure out how to make them profitable again. For a week I tried to solve it, but I couldn’t, so I went in and told them they could go fuck themselves-
Person B: I started my own company five years later with the goal to change the global supply chain forever. I wanted to automate repetitive tasks, to give people their time back so they can spend it in a fulfilling way–

Person A: They said we are supposed to meet weekly, but you didn't answer the email. They sent an email.
Person A: It’s very easy. The email has a link. You just click on a date and a time for the second appointment- It will pop up in your calendar-
Person A: Listen, if you don’t want to be my mentor, I totally understand. I’ll ask someone else, but I do want one. They say it makes a huge difference. There’s lots of other people I can ask, so-
Person A: We are supposed to meet once a week, that’s how it works. I didn’t make the rules.

Person B: Do you understand that your behavior is totally out of line?
Person A: Is it?

Person B: Leaving me notes? Calling me? Sending me milk?
Person A: Well- you drank it all...
Person B: Texting me? Inviting me to this ridiculous hotel? Keeping me waiting- Are you fucking insane?
Person B: We need to have a very serious conversation, you and I, we need to talk this through. Get to the bottom of it. You need to realize that what you’re doing is wrong-
Person A: I don’t think I want to talk.
Person A: Sorry but- I’m confused - You don’t know me. I’m a total- stranger, but you show up here, dressed like this- and you want me to just look at you- and- not do anything?
Person A: I’m not some thing you can just pick up and play with.
Person B: Oh, shut the fuck up.
Person A: Get on your knees.
Person B: What? No!
Person A: I just feel...Is That what you want? I don’t know how to- If that’s what you want - Be honest.
Person A: Is it?
Person B: I don’t know.
Person B: You’re very young- I don’t want to hurt you.
Person A: Hurt me? I think I have power over you, not the other way around. I mean, one call and you lose everything. Right?
Person A: Does that turn you on, when I say that?
Person A: Get on your knees.
Person B: Ok. I have to go.
Person A: No. Not like that. I don’t like it like that. I don’t want it like that-
Person A: Don’t.
Person A: Stop! Stop!
Person A: Please take your clothes off-
Person B: No.
Person A: Why not?
Person B: I don’t know. I don’t want to.
Person A: Ok. That’s ok.
Person A: Would you mind getting on your hands and knees for me?
Person B: Why?
Person A: Could you maybe try? For the sake of what we’re trying to...do here?
Person A: No- no. It’s ok-
Person B: I’m gonna...I don’t wanna pee-

Person A: Hey! You forgot your laptop at the office! Esme told me to bring it to you!
Person A: She said you couldn’t survive a minute without it.
Person A: I thought- better in person- in case... Sensitive information... I took the train.
Person B: Oh! I’m so sorry. Yes. Of course!

Person A: They’re so nice- You’re family- That’s what I want, for myself. Later.
Person B: My family is everything to me. Don’t you ever do that again.

Person A: I’m going to talk to someone and ask to be transferred to a different department.
Person B: You can’t do that- They will ask questions. They will investigate. You can’t- You can’t do that- They could- fire me.
Person A: I thought this was your company.

Person A: The way you look at me. As if you’re expecting me to- do that. To take it all away.
Person B: No.
Person A: Until you have nothing? Until you are nothing?
Person A: Are you using me to do that?
Person B: No, of course not.
Person A: That scares the shit out of me.

Person B: No- I’m not doing that. I promise. I’m not. I just think cause you’re young and I’m older than you- I want to be protective. I don’t want to hurt you-
Person A: You keep saying that- but- I’m fine. I’m totally fine. I think you’re the one who’s hurting.
Person A: Listen- You don’t have to worry about it. What we do is- If we continue to do this- It’s totally normal. I mean... - as long as it’s... you know- consensual-
Person B: What does that mean?
Person A: It’s about giving and taking power, no?
Person B: Come on- What did you do? Go to the library, looked it up?
Person A: No! I’m just saying- It has nothing to do with your- family or the company- It’s between us.

Person B: I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to- I’m just nervous.
Person A: You’re nervous? Yeah you look nervous. You’re all.. You’re acting all...
Person A: Why are you nervous? Why are you so nervous?
Person A: Just to be safe- If we continue to do this- We need to set some rules- that you and I both agree on. Like; I don’t know.... ...starting with: I tell you what to do and- you do it.
Person B: Oh, come on... Jesus Christ!
Person A: See! This is what I mean- this is what I’m talking about-
Person B: I’m sorry, I’m so sorry, No, no, no, wait come on- Sit down. I’m sorry- Sit down.

Person B: Please?
Person A: You have to be the one to say it. That’s how this works.
Person B: How what works? I don’t-
Person A: This! The dynamic. It’s about trust!
Person B: I thought you said it had to be consensual.
Person A: Yes, that’s what consent is Romy! That’s what it is. You have to agree to it. Both parties have to agree to it.
Person B: And if I don’t?
Person A: Then I will have to go talk to someone-
Person B: No, don’t do that. Please?

Person A: Come on. Just admit that this is what you want. Be honest.
Person A: You don’t look comfortable. You don’t look comfortable at all- Why don’t you sit over there?
Person A: Sit on the edge, right there-
Person A: Ok, you need to say it out loud, otherwise I’m gonna have to go talk to someone and ask to be transferred-
Person B: No, wait wait-
Person B: What are the words?
Person A: You know the words.
Person B: I don’t- I- don’t.
Person A: You do. Just say it.
Person B: Ok, ok--I’ll say it.

Person A: I need to hear you say...
Person A: You can do it.
Person B: What do you want me to say?
Person A: I... will... do...
Person B: I will do-
Person A: Whatever you tell me to do.
Person B: Whatever you tell me to do.
Person B: I will do whatever you tell me to do.
Person A: Say it again.
Person B: I will do whatever you tell me to do.
Person A: Good.

Person A: Hey! There’s a whole living room in here!
Person A: Stay.
Person B: Don’t stare at me.
Person A: Why?
Person B: I don’t like to be looked at.
Person A: Ok. I understand that. Go make yourself a drink.
Person B: I don’t- .
Person A: All of it.
Person B: No.
Person A: Don’t say no.
Person A: Take your panties off.

Person B: You take them off.
Person A: Don’t tell me what to do.
Person A: Open your legs.
Person A: How does that make you feel?
Person B: Scared.
Person A: Ok. You want to take your dress off for me now? So I can see you?
Person A: But you’re going to do it anyway?
Person A: -can’t hear you-
Person B: Yes.
Person A: Yes what?
Person B: Yes, I will take my dress off.
Person A: Ok.

Person A: You’re beautiful.
Person B: No...
Person A: You are.
Person A: You’re so beautiful.
Person A: You’re my babygirl.
Person A: Go ahead.
Person A: What’s the safe word?
Person B: What?
Person A: Don’t we need a safe word?
Person B: Eh- Jacob?
Person A: Your husbands name?
Person A: Ok.

Person A: Can you do your therapy on me?
Person B: No.
Person A: Cause you’re afraid of what might come out of me?
Person B: No, because I’m not a therapist.
Person A: Do you think I’m a - bad...person?
Person B: No. You’re a lovely person. You sense things- You know things- what people want- what they need-
Person A: I scare myself. Sometimes.
Person B: You don’t scare me.

Person B: Are you dating her?
Person B: I don’t want you to see other women. You’re mine-
Person B: Do you do with her- what you do with me?
Person A: She’s not like that Romy. That’s why I like her in a different way. That’s why I like myself in a different way, with her.

Person A: I could drown you, right here. No one would know it was me.
Person B: You should.
